title: The Asset Allocator: Of Market Tops And Other Entry Points
author: Seeking Alpha
dc:creator: Seeking Alpha
description: Seeking Alpha contributor Ploutos calculates that someone who invested on the pre-global financial crisis market peak in 2007 would have more than doubled his money by staying invested until now. This is an important reminder for market timers out there. This podcast (4:49) suggests that disciplined asset allocation can enhance client outcomes, especially during the market rough patches that have the greatest positive impact on long-term investment returns.
